summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and French attorneys representing a client, discussing the SDNY's request to interview the client regarding the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. The client ultimately declines to be interviewed.

persons.name: Nicolas Cassart
persons.context: French attorney at FARTHOUAT AVOCATS representing a client who declines an interview request from SDNY prosecutors regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Nicolas Boulay
persons.context: French attorney at FARTHOUAT AVOCATS, copied on emails with SDNY prosecutors regarding a client interview request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the ongoing SDNY investigation mentioned by prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of prosecution by SDNY, mentioned by prosecutors.

connections.description: Partners at the law firm FARTHOUAT AVOCATS, coordinating on communication with SDNY prosecutors.
Cassart represents the client who is the subject of the SDNY interview request.
Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office are attempting to secure an interview with Cassart's client for their investigation.

events.title: Initial Call between SDNY and Attorneys
events.description: SDNY prosecutors and attorneys Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay held an initial discussion, after which a protective order was sent.

events.title: Client Declines SDNY Interview
events.description: Attorney Nicolas Cassart informs SDNY prosecutors that his client has decided not to be interviewed for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking to interview a witness/client represented by French attorneys in March-April 2021 as part of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The client, after discussion with her attorneys, made a 'clear and final decision' not to be interviewed by U.S. authorities.
The communication shows international coordination efforts by the SDNY, reaching out to French legal counsel.
A protective order from the presiding judge in the Maxwell case was shared with the attorneys, indicating the sensitive nature of the requested interview.
